meanings.definition: A long, wavering, high-pitched vocal sound resembling a howl or wail.
meanings.sent1: The ululation of the wind through the trees filled the night with eerie sounds.
meanings.sent2: The women's ululation at the celebration added a traditional touch to the event.
meanings.sent3: The ululation of the baby trying to mimic a wolf made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her ululation of joy echoed through the valley, reaching every corner.
meanings.sent5: The ululation of the singer was so piercing, it stayed in the audience's memory for days.

meanings.sent1: The ululation of the crowd could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent2: During the ceremony, the ululation of the participants created a festive atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The ululation of the fans after the team's victory was contagious.
meanings.sent4: Her ululation of excitement was like a beacon in the dark room.
meanings.sent5: The ululation of the dancers added a unique rhythm to the performance.
